ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it if you have a lot of time, and you're actually going to commit to getting the projects started early. You learn a ton, and the more you put into it, the more you get out. You learn how to do actual science!
Very time consuming but relevant and rewarding. Get ready for countless hours on the electronics experiment. If something isn't working, don't waste two hours trying to fix it, GET HELP FROM TA.
Allot of hands-on experience, very time consuming but worthwhile.

I would summarize this class as the "real world" application of the principles learned in the class, as well as the information needed for everyday physical chemistry lab time that would not necessarily be taught in a class. I would highly recommend this class to another student.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I'm an undergrad, but it was still incredibly helpful. It teaches you how to be independently motivated in undertaking a project. It teaches valuable research tools (computer programming, electronics, vacuum systems) and makes you do an actual Resonance Raman experiment, a very valuable type of optical spectroscopy to understand.
Prepares me very well for future research work.
I can't believe how much I learned.
This class is very helpful in that the modules covered stuff that are essential aspects to most physical chemistry labs.
